challenges.title: Anaconda Overview
description: Continuum Analytics provides the most popular bundle of Python, Jupyter, and a number of other packages for data science: Ananconda. The documentation describes Anaconda as an 'easy-to-install free package manager, environment manager, Python distribution, and collection of over 720 open source packages offering free community support.' You can use Python 2, Python 3, and even R using Anaconda. Anaconda also provides infrastructure for sharing both notebooks and packages through Anaconda Cloud.
An image of the Anaconda download screen .
To install Anaconda, you should first download it from the Continuum Analytics website. For the work we will be doing, you should select Python 3.

challenges.title: Anaconda
description: Make sure you have download and installed the Python 3 version of Anaconda from the Continuum Analytics website.
Open a terminal window within the AnalyticsDojo/materials/analyticsdojo directory.
Launch Jupyter with the command jupyter notebook
Open a web browser at http://localhost:8888 and verify that Jupyter is running and you have access to all of the folders.
Open a local notebook (in analyticsdojo/classes/01-overview/local-intro.ipynb) and verify you can upload data locally.
